item.title: Arifah add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Jostein Gaarder
item.description: "Wisest is she who knows she does not know." -- Jostein Gaarder

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Fatima Mernissi
item.description: "But Aunt Habiba said not to worry, that everyone had wonderful things hidden inside. The only difference was that some managed to share those wonderful things, and others did not. Those who did not explore and share the precious gifts within went through life feeling miserable, sad, awkward with others, and angry too. You had to develop a talent, Aunt Habiba said, so that you could give something, share and shine. And you developed a talent by working very hard at becoming good at something. It could be anything - singing, dancing, cooking, embroidering, listening, looking, smiling, waiting, accepting, dreaming, rebelling, leaping. 'Anything you can do well can change your life', said Aunt Habiba." -- Fatima Mernissi

item.title: Arifah add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Eric Weiner
item.description: "Money matters but less than we think and not in the way that we think. Family is important. So are friends. Envy is toxic. So is excessive thinking. Beaches are optional. Trust is not. Neither is gratitude." -- Eric Weiner

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Eric Weiner
item.description: "So the greatest source of happiness is other people--and what does money do? It isolates us from other people. It enables us to build walls, literal and figurative, around ourselves. We move from a teeming college dorm to an apartment to a house, and if we're really wealthy, to an estate. We think we're moving up, but really we're walling off ourselves." -- Eric Weiner

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Eric Weiner
item.description: "[Happiness is] a ghost, it’s a shadow. You can’t really chase it. It’s a by-product, a very pleasant side effect to a life lived well." -- Eric Weiner

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Eric Weiner
item.description: "I've always believed that happiness is just around the corner. The trick is fining the right corner." -- Eric Weiner

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Eric Weiner
item.description: "Until the eighteenth century, people believed that biblical paradise, the Garden of Eden, was a real place. It appeared on maps--located, ironically, at the confluence of the Tigris and Euphrates rivers, in what is now modern-day Iraq." -- Eric Weiner

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Eric Weiner
item.description: "The late British-born philosopher Alan Watts, in one of his wonderful lectures on eastern philosophy, used this analogy: "If I draw a circle, most people, when asked what I have drawn, will say I have drawn a circle or a disc, or a ball. Very few people will say I've drawn a hole in the wall, because most people think of the inside first, rather than thinking of the outside. But actually these two sides go together--you cannot have what is 'in here' unless you have what is out there.' " In other words, where we are is vital to who we are." -- Eric Weiner

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Eric Weiner
item.description: "Ketika pohon terakhir ditebang, Ketika sungai terakhir dikosongkan, Ketika ikan terakhir ditangkap, Barulah manusia akan menyadari bahwa dia tidak dapat memakan uang." -- Eric Weiner

item.title: Arifah add a quote by Eric Weiner
item.description: "Demikian pula halnya, hanya ketidakbahagiaan yang memiliki makna. Itulah sebabnya mengapa kita merasa terpaksa membicarakannya dan punya banyak kata untuk melukiskannya. Kebahagiaan tidak membutuhkan kata-kata." -- Eric Weiner
